alert.note: Alert for Bullock (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:29PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bullock and northwestern Barbour Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 129 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pickett, or near Midway, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Union Springs, Midway, Clayton, Pickett, Aberfoil, Barbour County Public Lake Dam, Three Notch, Perote and Mount Andrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
